TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {10340=UNFCCC Latin American regional workshop on adaptation Lima, Peru, 18 to 20 April 2006, 36799=© 2014 United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change}
textBeforeTable: Session 1  Introduction and background Objectives of the workshop and recent developments on adaptation under the UNFCCC   Presentations Report on the Latin American regional workshop on adaptation Background paper on Impacts, Vulnerability and Adaptation to Climate Change in Latin America   Final agenda The UNFCCC secretariat has convened this workshop in accordance with  Decision 1/CP.10, under the guidance of the Chair of the Subsidiary Body for Implementation. The main objective of the workshop was to facilitate information exchange and integrated assessments to assist in identifying specific adaptation needs and concerns.   Background     UNFCCC Latin American regional workshop on adaptation Lima, Peru, 18 to 20 April 2006 Your location: Home
textAfterTable: Vulnerability and adaptation in Cuba, the drought case Ms. Mirza Castro Honduras Vulnerabilidad actual de la cuenca del rio Aguan en Honduras Mr. Freddy Picado Traña Nicaragua Experiencias de Nicaragua en evaluacion de la vulnerabilidad y adaptacion al cambio climatico    Climate methods and tools - availability, applicability,  accessibility and training opportunities   Presenter Party/Organization Subject Mr. Haroldo Machado Filho Brasil Modelo regional de cambio global del clima modelo eta CPTEC Mr. Carlos Nobre Resource person Summary of recommendations Mr. Yolando Velasco UNFCCC Secretariat Regional hands-on training workshop on vulnerability and adaptation assessments  Session 3  Adaptation planning and implementation Adaptation planning and implementation, including possible needs and concerns Presenter Party/Organization Subject Mr. Cesar Buitrago Colombia
